title: C Programming Fundamentals
description: Build a rock-solid foundation in programming with C, one of the most influential languages ever created. This course takes you from the absolute basics of syntax and data types to the powerful, low-level concepts of pointers and dynamic memory management, equipping you with skills essential for systems programming, embedded systems, and performance-critical applications.
curriculum: Setting up the C Development Environment (GCC)
Structures, Unions, and File I/O Operations
Final Project: Build a Simple Command-Line Application

title: C++ Object-Oriented Programming
description: Unlock the power of high-performance software development with C++. This course focuses on mastering Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles to write modular, reusable, and efficient code. You will delve into classes, inheritance, polymorphism, and the essential Standard Template Library (STL) for data structures and algorithms.
curriculum: Week 1: C++ Basics and Procedural Programming
References, Functions Overloading, and Default Arguments
Polymorphism: Virtual Functions and Abstract Classes
The Standard Template Library (STL): Containers, Iterators, and Algorithms
Final Project: Design a Small Class-Based System

title: Java Programming
description: Master Java, the 'write once, run anywhere' language that powers enterprise-level applications, Android development, and large-scale systems. This course provides a comprehensive guide to Core Java, including its powerful Collections Framework for data management and essential multithreading concepts for building concurrent applications.
curriculum: Core Java Syntax, Variables, and Control Flow
Object-Oriented Programming in Java: Classes, Inheritance, Polymorphism
File I/O and Introduction to Java Streams
Final Project: Build a Console-Based Application using Collections

title: Python Programming
description: Dive into Python, the world's most popular language for data science, web development, and automation. This course is designed for beginners and covers everything from basic syntax to object-oriented programming. You will gain hands-on experience with essential libraries and frameworks, preparing you to build real-world applications.
curriculum: Python Syntax, Variables, and Data Types
Data Structures: Lists, Tuples, Dictionaries, and Sets
Introduction to Popular Libraries (e.g., Pandas for data, Requests for web)
Final Project: Create a Script to Automate a Simple Task

title: JavaScript & ES6+
description: Master the language of the web with modern JavaScript. This course goes beyond the basics to cover the powerful ES6+ features that enable cleaner, more efficient, and more readable code. You'll learn asynchronous programming with Promises and async/await, understand JavaScript modules, and gain the skills needed for modern frontend and backend development.
curriculum: Variables (var, let, const), Scope, and Hoisting
Arrow Functions, Template Literals, and Destructuring
The Event Loop, Callbacks, and Callback Hell
Final Project: Build a small app that fetches data from a public API

title: Go Programming
description: Learn Go (Golang), the powerful language developed by Google, designed for building simple, reliable, and efficient software. This course is tailored for developers looking to build high-performance web services and microservices, with a deep dive into Go's standout feature: built-in concurrency using goroutines and channels.
curriculum: Go Syntax, Data Types, and Packages
Composite Types: Structs, Slices, and Maps
Building a RESTful API in Go
Final Project: Develop a Simple Concurrent Web Service

title: Rust Programming
description: Step into the world of systems programming with Rust, a language that guarantees memory safety and thread safety without a garbage collector. This course is for developers who want to write blazingly fast and safe software. You will master Rust's unique ownership and borrowing system, learn to handle concurrency fearlessly, and build reliable command-line tools.
curriculum: Fearless Concurrency with Threads and Message Passing

title: Data Structures & Algorithms
description: Move beyond just writing code to writing efficient and scalable code. This crucial course strengthens your problem-solving abilities by providing a deep understanding of fundamental data structures and algorithms. You'll learn to analyze code performance with Big O notation and apply the right tools to solve complex computational problems, making you a standout candidate in technical interviews.
curriculum: Week 1: Core Concepts and Linear Data Structures
Algorithm Analysis and Big O Notation
Trees, Binary Trees, and Binary Search Trees (BSTs)
Week 3: Advanced Data Structures and Sorting
Sorting Algorithms (Bubble, Selection, Insertion, Merge, Quick)

title: HTML5 & CSS3 Mastery
description: Build the structural and visual foundation of any website or web application. This course covers modern HTML5 for creating semantic, accessible markup and dives deep into CSS3 for styling. You will master powerful layout techniques like Flexbox and Grid, and learn to create engaging user experiences with transitions and animations.
curriculum: Semantic HTML5 Elements (header, nav, article, etc.)
CSS Syntax, Selectors, and the Cascade
The Box Model and Basic Layout
Week 2: Advanced CSS Layout and Animations
Final Project: Build a Static, Visually Appealing Web Page

title: Responsive Web Design
description: Ensure your websites look and work perfectly on all devices, from mobile phones to desktop monitors. This course teaches the essential principles of responsive web design, starting with a mobile-first approach. You'll master CSS media queries, learn to leverage popular CSS frameworks, and understand web accessibility (WCAG) to create inclusive digital experiences.
curriculum: CSS Media Queries for Different Viewports
Designing for Touch and Different Input Types
Introduction to a CSS Framework (e.g., Bootstrap or Tailwind CSS)
Final Project: Convert a static design to a fully responsive website

title: JavaScript DOM & APIs
description: Transform static web pages into dynamic, interactive applications. This course dives into the Document Object Model (DOM), teaching you how to manipulate page content, structure, and styles with JavaScript. You'll also learn to communicate with servers using the Fetch API and leverage browser APIs like localStorage to build modern web experiences.
curriculum: Week 1: Understanding and Manipulating the DOM
What is the DOM? Accessing Nodes
Making asynchronous requests with the Fetch API
Storing data in the browser with localStorage and sessionStorage
Final Project: Build an interactive to-do list or a simple API client

title: React.js Development
description: Build modern, fast, and scalable user interfaces with React, the leading JavaScript library for frontend development. This course takes you from the fundamentals of JSX and components to advanced state management with Hooks. You'll learn to think in React and build reusable UI components to create complex, interactive single-page applications.
curriculum: Setting up a React Environment (Create React App)
Global State Management with the Context API
Final Project: Build a multi-page application that fetches and displays data

title: Angular Framework
description: Build powerful, enterprise-grade single-page applications with Angular, Google's opinionated frontend framework. This course provides a comprehensive guide to the Angular ecosystem, leveraging TypeScript for robust and maintainable code. You'll master concepts like components, services, dependency injection, and routing to build feature-rich applications.
curriculum: Introduction to TypeScript: Types, Classes, and Interfaces
Setting up an Angular Project with Angular CLI
Angular Architecture: Modules, Components, and Templates
Introduction to Services and Dependency Injection
Client-Side Routing with the Angular Router
Building Reactive Forms for complex validation
Final Project: Build a complete single-page application with multiple views

title: Vue.js Framework
description: Discover Vue.js, the progressive JavaScript framework known for its simplicity and approachability. This course will guide you through building interactive and performant web interfaces, from basic concepts to advanced state management. You'll explore the elegant Composition API, manage global state with Pinia/Vuex, and get an introduction to Nuxt.js for server-rendered applications.
curriculum: Setting up a Vue Project with Vue CLI/Vite
Template Syntax, Directives, and Data Binding
Introduction to the Composition API (setup function)
Global State Management with Pinia (or Vuex)
Final Project: Build a single-page application with routing and state management

title: Node.js & Express
description: Take your JavaScript skills to the server side with Node.js and Express. This course teaches you how to build fast, scalable, and data-intensive backend applications and RESTful APIs. You'll master the asynchronous, non-blocking nature of Node.js and learn to structure applications effectively with the minimalist and powerful Express framework.
curriculum: Understanding the Node.js Runtime and Event Loop
Working with the File System and Asynchronous Callbacks
Routing and Handling HTTP Requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
Connecting to a Database (e.g., MongoDB with Mongoose)
Final Project: Build and test a complete RESTful API for a simple application

title: Python Web Frameworks
description: Leverage the power and simplicity of Python for backend development. This course explores the landscape of Python web frameworks, giving you hands-on experience with the most popular choices: Django for building full-featured, database-driven websites; Flask for lightweight microservices; and FastAPI for building high-performance, modern APIs.
curriculum: Building a Simple REST API with Flask
Final Project: Choose a framework to build a simple CRUD application

title: Java Spring Boot
description: Build production-ready, stand-alone microservices and web applications with Spring Boot. This course simplifies Java backend development by leveraging Spring Boot's convention-over-configuration approach. You will learn to build RESTful APIs, secure your application with Spring Security, and interact with databases seamlessly using Spring Data JPA.
curriculum: Week 1: Introduction to Spring and Spring Boot
The Spring Framework and Dependency Injection
Week 2: Data Persistence with Spring Data JPA
Connecting to a Database (e.g., H2, PostgreSQL)
Spring MVC and Thymeleaf for Server-Side Rendering
Securing your application with Spring Security
Introduction to Unit and Integration Testing
Building and Deploying a Spring Boot Application
Final Project: Develop a secure, data-driven web application

title: PHP & Laravel
description: Discover the power and elegance of modern PHP development with Laravel, one of the most popular web application frameworks in the world. This course covers the latest features of PHP and dives deep into Laravel's expressive syntax and rich feature set, including the Eloquent ORM for database interaction and the Blade templating engine for beautiful views.
curriculum: Week 1: Modern PHP and Laravel Setup
Setting up a Laravel Project with Composer
Laravel's Directory Structure and Artisan CLI
The Eloquent ORM: Models and Relationships
Building a RESTful API with Laravel
Final Project: Build a complete CRUD application

title: Ruby on Rails
description: Learn to build full-stack web applications rapidly with Ruby on Rails, the framework famous for its 'convention over configuration' philosophy. This course will teach you the fundamentals of the Ruby language and guide you through the Rails MVC (Model-View-Controller) architecture, using ActiveRecord for seamless database interaction and building RESTful designs with ease.
curriculum: Week 1: Ruby Fundamentals and Rails Setup
Ruby Syntax, Data Types, and Control Structures
Final Project: Build a blog or a simple e-commerce site

title: ASP.NET Core
description: Build high-performance, cross-platform web applications with Microsoft's ASP.NET Core framework and the C# language. This comprehensive course covers building both traditional MVC web applications and modern Web APIs. You will learn to use Entity Framework Core for powerful data access and gain the skills to develop robust, enterprise-ready applications.
curriculum: C# Syntax, Data Types, and OOP Principles
Introduction to the .NET CLI and Visual Studio
The MVC Pattern: Models, Views, and Controllers
Week 3: Data Access with Entity Framework Core
Querying and Saving Data with EF Core
Final Project: Build a data-driven web application with a separate API

title: RESTful API Design
description: Learn the art and science of designing clean, scalable, and easy-to-use RESTful APIs. This course moves beyond just creating endpoints to cover the industry best practices for API design. You'll learn about proper resource naming, HTTP methods, status codes, versioning strategies, and how to create clear documentation that developers love.
curriculum: Week 1: REST Principles and Best Practices
What is REST? Core Principles and Constraints
Proper Use of HTTP Methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH)
HTTP Status Codes for Meaningful Responses
Final Project: Design and document an API for a given application scenario

title: SQL Fundamentals
description: Unlock the power of data by mastering SQL (Structured Query Language), the universal language for interacting with relational databases. This course is essential for anyone in a data-driven role, covering everything from basic queries to complex joins. You will gain hands-on experience with popular databases like MySQL or PostgreSQL and learn fundamental query optimization techniques.
curriculum: Filtering with `WHERE` and Sorting with `ORDER BY`
Aggregating Data with `GROUP BY` and Aggregate Functions (COUNT, SUM, AVG)
Combining Data from Multiple Tables with `JOIN`
Introduction to Indexes and Query Optimization

title: Advanced Database Design
description: Go beyond basic table creation and learn to design efficient, scalable, and robust relational database schemas. This course covers the theory and practice of advanced database design, including normalization to eliminate data redundancy, indexing strategies to speed up queries, and transaction management to ensure data integrity.
curriculum: First, Second, and Third Normal Forms (1NF, 2NF, 3NF)
Choosing the Right Columns to Index
Final Project: Design a normalized database schema for a complex application

title: NoSQL Databases
description: Explore the diverse world of NoSQL databases, designed for the scalability, flexibility, and performance demands of modern applications. This course explains the 'why' behind NoSQL, covering the CAP theorem and different data models. You will get hands-on experience with MongoDB, a leading document database, and an overview of other types like key-value and column-family stores.
curriculum: SQL vs. NoSQL: When to use which?
The CAP Theorem (Consistency, Availability, Partition Tolerance)
Types of NoSQL Databases (Document, Key-Value, Column-Family, Graph)
Introduction to MongoDB and its Shell
Final Project: Build an application backend using MongoDB

title: Redis & Caching
description: Dramatically improve your application's performance by mastering caching strategies with Redis. This course introduces you to Redis, the blazingly fast in-memory data store, and its versatile data structures. You'll learn common caching patterns and implement them to reduce database load, decrease latency, and create a better user experience.
curriculum: Introduction to Caching and In-Memory Databases
Redis Data Structures (Strings, Hashes, Lists, Sets, Sorted Sets)
Using Redis for more than caching (Pub/Sub, Queues)
Final Project: Integrate Redis caching into a sample web application

title: Elasticsearch & Search
description: Implement powerful, fast, and relevant search experiences in your applications with Elasticsearch. This course covers the fundamentals of full-text search and dives into the Elasticsearch ecosystem. You will learn how to index data, build complex queries, use aggregations for analytics, and leverage the full ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) for logging and visualization.
curriculum: Introduction to Full-Text Search and Inverted Indexes
Week 3: Aggregations and the ELK Stack
Introduction to Logstash for Data Ingestion
Final Project: Build a search engine for a dataset

title: Database Administration
description: Learn the essential skills to manage, maintain, and secure production databases. This course provides practical knowledge for aspiring Database Administrators (DBAs), covering critical tasks like setting up robust backup and recovery strategies, monitoring performance, tuning queries, and managing user access and security.
curriculum: Installing and Configuring a Database Server (e.g., PostgreSQL)
Week 3: Performance Tuning and High Availability
Analyzing Query Plans and Identifying Bottlenecks
Introduction to Replication and High Availability
Final Project: Perform a full backup, restore, and performance analysis cycle

title: Data Warehousing
description: Learn how to design and build data warehouses to support business intelligence and analytics. This course covers the end-to-end process, from extracting and transforming data with ETL pipelines to designing dimensional models optimized for reporting. You'll understand the key concepts of OLAP, star schemas, and snowflake schemas.
curriculum: Tools for ETL (e.g., an overview of tools like Talend or Airflow)
Final Project: Design a star schema for a business case

title: Graph Databases
description: Move beyond tables and rows to model the world as it truly is: a network of rich relationships. This course introduces you to graph databases and their power in handling highly connected data. You'll get hands-on experience with Neo4j and the Cypher query language to solve problems that are difficult or slow for traditional relational databases, such as social networks, fraud detection, and recommendation engines.
curriculum: Graph Theory Basics: Nodes, Relationships, Properties
Basic Cypher Syntax for Reading Data
Final Project: Model and query a small social network

title: AWS Fundamentals
description: Begin your journey into the cloud with Amazon Web Services (AWS), the leading cloud provider. This course is your starting point, covering the essential, foundational services. You will learn to launch virtual servers with EC2, store data with S3, build isolated networks with VPC, and manage access securely with IAM. This is the first step towards any cloud-based career.
curriculum: Introduction to Cloud Computing and AWS Global Infrastructure
Identity and Access Management (IAM): Users, Groups, Roles, Policies
Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2): Launching and Managing Virtual Servers
Simple Storage Service (S3): Object Storage Basics
Virtual Private Cloud (VPC): Building Your Private Network in the Cloud
Final Project: Deploy a simple web server in a custom VPC on EC2

title: AWS Advanced Services
description: Go beyond the basics and harness the full power of the AWS platform. This course dives into advanced services that enable modern, scalable, and cost-effective architectures. You will learn to run code without servers using Lambda, manage containers at scale with EKS, deploy managed relational databases with RDS, and define your infrastructure as code with CloudFormation.
curriculum: AWS Lambda: Introduction to Serverless Computing
Elastic Container Service (ECS) and Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS)
Simple Queue Service (SQS) and Simple Notification Service (SNS)
AWS CloudFormation: Defining Infrastructure as Code
Final Project: Deploy a serverless application using Lambda, API Gateway, and DynamoDB

title: AWS Solutions Architecture
description: Learn to design and build systems on AWS like a professional Solutions Architect. This course is built around the AWS Well-Architected Framework, teaching you how to create solutions that are secure, high-performing, resilient, and cost-efficient. You will study common architectural patterns and best practices to prepare for real-world design challenges and the AWS Certified Solutions Architect exam.
curriculum: Designing for High Availability and Fault Tolerance
Final Project: Design a complete, well-architected solution for a given business problem

title: Azure Fundamentals
description: Start your cloud computing journey with Microsoft Azure. This course provides a foundational understanding of Azure's core services, perfect for beginners. You will learn how to create and manage virtual machines, understand different storage options, build virtual networks, and manage identity and access with Azure Active Directory. This is the first step towards earning Azure certifications.
curriculum: Introduction to Cloud Computing and Azure
Azure Active Directory (AAD) for Identity Management
Final Project: Deploy a web server on an Azure VM within a custom VNet

title: Azure Advanced Services
description: Leverage the full capabilities of the Microsoft Azure platform by exploring its advanced services. This course will guide you through building modern applications using Azure Functions for serverless computing, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) for container orchestration, Cosmos DB for globally distributed databases, and Logic Apps for workflow automation.
curriculum: Azure Cosmos DB: Globally Distributed NoSQL Database
Azure Logic Apps and Service Bus for Integration
Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Templates for IaC
Final Project: Build a serverless API using Azure Functions and Cosmos DB

title: Azure Solutions Architecture
description: Master the art of designing and implementing robust, scalable, and secure solutions on Microsoft Azure. This course is structured around the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework, covering key design principles. You'll explore enterprise patterns, hybrid cloud strategies, and governance best practices to prepare for complex, real-world architectural challenges.
curriculum: Designing for High Availability and Disaster Recovery
Hybrid Cloud Architecture with Azure Arc
Azure Policy and Blueprints for Governance
Final Project: Design a comprehensive Azure solution for an enterprise scenario

title: Google Cloud Platform
description: Explore the innovative world of Google Cloud Platform (GCP), known for its strengths in data analytics, machine learning, and container orchestration. This course provides a solid introduction to GCP's core infrastructure and services, including Compute Engine for VMs, Cloud Storage, the serverless data warehouse BigQuery, and Google's powerful AI services.
curriculum: GCP Global Infrastructure and Resource Hierarchy
Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) Networking in GCP
Overview of GCP's AI and ML Services
Final Project: Deploy a web application on GCE using Cloud SQL

title: Multi-Cloud Architecture
description: Avoid vendor lock-in and leverage the best services from different cloud providers by mastering multi-cloud architecture. This course explores the strategies, benefits, and challenges of building and managing applications that span across AWS, Azure, and GCP. You will learn about interoperability, data management, and governance in a multi-cloud world.
curriculum: Why Multi-Cloud? Drivers and Use Cases
Tools for Multi-Cloud Management (e.g., Terraform, Anthos)
Networking and Security in a Multi-Cloud Environment

title: Cloud Cost Optimization
description: Gain control over your cloud spending and maximize business value with FinOps. This practical course teaches you the principles and practices of cloud cost optimization. You will learn how to monitor cloud usage, identify and eliminate waste, choose the right pricing models (e.g., Reserved Instances, Savings Plans), and implement a culture of cost accountability.
curriculum: Understanding Cloud Billing and Cost Allocation
Using Cloud Provider Cost Management Tools (AWS Cost Explorer, Azure Cost Management)
Leveraging Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, and Spot Instances
Automating Cost Optimization (e.g., shutting down idle resources)

title: Serverless Computing
description: Focus on your code, not your servers. This course is a deep dive into serverless computing, the paradigm that lets you build and run applications without managing infrastructure. You will get hands-on experience building event-driven architectures with leading Functions-as-a-Service (FaaS) platforms like AWS Lambda and Azure Functions.
curriculum: What is Serverless? FaaS and BaaS
Writing and Deploying Your First Lambda Function
Connecting Functions to other services (e.g., S3, DynamoDB, API Gateway)

title: Cloud Networking
description: Master the networking foundation of the cloud. This course provides a deep understanding of core cloud networking concepts, essential for building secure and scalable applications. You will learn to design and manage virtual private networks, configure load balancers for high availability, use CDNs to accelerate content delivery, and manage DNS.
curriculum: VPC Fundamentals: Subnets, Route Tables, Internet Gateways
Network Access Control Lists (NACLs) vs. Security Groups
Designing Secure and Scalable VPC Architectures
Configuring Load Balancers for High Availability
DNS Management (e.g., AWS Route 53, Azure DNS)
Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) (e.g., AWS CloudFront, Azure CDN)
Hybrid Connectivity: VPNs and Direct Connect/ExpressRoute
Final Project: Design a multi-tier network architecture in the cloud

title: Cloud Storage Solutions
description: Learn to choose and implement the right storage solution for your application's needs in the cloud. This course covers the main types of cloud storage: object storage for scalability, block storage for performance, and file storage for shared access. You'll also learn to implement effective data backup and disaster recovery strategies.
curriculum: Object Storage (AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage): Use cases and features
Block Storage (AWS EBS, Azure Disk Storage): Attaching to VMs
File Storage (AWS EFS, Azure Files): Shared file systems
Choosing the right storage type for your workload
Storage Tiers and Lifecycle Policies for cost savings
Implementing a backup solution in the cloud

title: Linux System Administration
description: Master the operating system that powers the majority of the world's servers. This course provides essential skills for any DevOps or backend professional, covering Linux command-line mastery, user and permission management, process and service control, and basic networking. You'll gain the confidence to manage and troubleshoot Linux servers in any environment.
curriculum: Final Project: Set up and secure a basic Linux web server

title: Docker & Containerization
description: Revolutionize the way you build, ship, and run applications with Docker. This course is a comprehensive introduction to containerization, teaching you how to package applications and their dependencies into portable containers. You'll learn to write Dockerfiles, manage images, run containers, and orchestrate multi-container applications with Docker Compose.
curriculum: Introduction to Containers vs. Virtual Machines
Managing Images and Containers (pull, push, run, stop, rm)
Final Project: Containerize a multi-service web application

title: Kubernetes Orchestration
description: Go beyond single containers and learn to manage, scale, and deploy containerized applications like a pro with Kubernetes, the industry-standard orchestration platform. This comprehensive course covers the core architecture, from pods and services to advanced topics like state management, networking with Ingress, and extending Kubernetes with operators. You'll gain the practical skills needed to run resilient, production-grade applications in any cloud environment.
curriculum: Kubernetes Architecture: Control Plane and Worker Nodes
Working with Pods, ReplicaSets, and Deployments
Advanced Networking with Ingress Controllers (e.g., NGINX)
Network Policies for Securing Pod Communication
Managing Application Configuration with ConfigMaps and Secrets
Persistent Storage: Volumes, PersistentVolumes (PV), and PersistentVolumeClaims (PVC)
Resource Management: Requests, Limits, and Quotas
Monitoring and Logging in Kubernetes (Prometheus & Grafana)
Introduction to Helm for Package Management
Final Project: Deploy a multi-tier application on a Kubernetes cluster

title: CI/CD Pipeline Development
description: Automate the process of building, testing, and deploying your software with CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment). This course provides hands-on experience building automated pipelines using today's most popular tools. You'll learn the principles of CI/CD and apply them using Jenkins, GitLab CI, and GitHub Actions to achieve faster, more reliable software delivery.
curriculum: Introduction to Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment
Creating your first Jenkins pipeline (Freestyle and Pipeline-as-code)
Building, testing, and deploying with GitHub Actions
Final Project: Build a complete CI/CD pipeline for a sample application

title: Infrastructure as Code
description: Stop managing servers manually and start defining your infrastructure with code. This course teaches the principles of Infrastructure as Code (IaC), enabling you to automate the provisioning and management of your cloud resources. You'll get hands-on experience with Terraform for multi-cloud provisioning, AWS CloudFormation, and Ansible for both provisioning and configuration.
curriculum: Terraform with a Cloud Provider (e.g., AWS)
Introduction to Ansible for Configuration Management and Provisioning
Using Ansible to configure cloud resources
Final Project: Provision a complete cloud infrastructure using Terraform

title: Configuration Management
description: Ensure consistency and reliability across your servers by automating their configuration. This course covers the fundamentals of configuration management, a key DevOps practice. You will get hands-on experience with Ansible, the simple yet powerful automation engine, to write playbooks that install software, manage files, and enforce the desired state of your systems.
curriculum: Week 1: Configuration Management Concepts and Ansible Basics
Using Ansible Vault for secrets management
Final Project: Write an Ansible playbook to configure a web server from scratch

title: Monitoring & Logging
description: Gain deep visibility into your systems to proactively identify and resolve issues. This course teaches the modern approach to observability, covering monitoring, logging, and tracing. You will get hands-on experience with the industry-standard open-source stack: Prometheus for metrics-based monitoring, Grafana for creating powerful visualizations, and the ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) for centralized logging.
curriculum: Week 1: Monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana
Week 2: Centralized Logging with the ELK Stack
Introduction to Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana
Shipping and Parsing Logs with Filebeat and Logstash
Final Project: Set up a complete monitoring and logging stack for a sample application

title: GitOps & Version Control
description: Master Git, the essential version control system for all modern software development, and take it a step further with GitOps. This course covers advanced Git workflows and branching strategies to improve team collaboration. You will then learn the principles of GitOps, a paradigm for using Git as the single source of truth to manage and automate infrastructure and application deployments.
curriculum: Collaborating with Pull Requests and Code Reviews
Introduction to GitOps tools (e.g., Argo CD or Flux)
Final Project: Manage a Kubernetes deployment using a GitOps workflow

title: Site Reliability Engineering
description: Learn the principles and practices of Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), the discipline pioneered by Google that treats operations as a software problem. This course covers the core tenets of SRE, including how to define and measure reliability using SLAs, SLOs, and SLIs, how to manage an error budget, and best practices for incident response, postmortems, and proactive reliability through chaos engineering.
curriculum: What is SRE? How it differs from DevOps
Service Level Objectives (SLOs), Indicators (SLIs), and Agreements (SLAs)
Error Budgets and Balancing Reliability with Innovation
Monitoring and Alerting Philosophy in SRE
Final Project: Define SLOs and an error budget for a sample service

title: DevSecOps
description: Integrate security seamlessly into every phase of your DevOps pipeline. This course teaches the DevSecOps mindset of 'shifting security left,' making security a shared responsibility from the start. You'll learn practical techniques for automating security checks, including static and dynamic analysis, dependency scanning, and infrastructure compliance, directly within your CI/CD workflows.
curriculum: Introduction to DevSecOps and Shifting Left
Week 2: Security in the CI/CD Pipeline
Software Composition Analysis (SCA) for dependency scanning
Final Project: Integrate a security scanner into a CI/CD pipeline

title: Android Native Development
description: Build beautiful, high-performance applications for the world's most popular mobile operating system. This course teaches you modern Android development from the ground up using Kotlin, the official language for Android. You'll learn to build responsive user interfaces with Jetpack Compose, manage data, and interact with the Android SDK to create feature-rich apps that follow Material Design guidelines.
curriculum: Your First Android App: Activities, Layouts, and the Manifest
Week 2: User Interface with Jetpack Compose
Introduction to Declarative UI with Jetpack Compose
Layouts, Themes, and State Management in Compose
Building Lists and Handling User Input
ViewModels and LiveData for UI State
Permissions and Working with Device Hardware
Publishing your app to the Google Play Store
Final Project: Build a complete app that fetches data from an API and stores it locally

title: iOS Native Development
description: Create elegant and intuitive applications for iPhone and iPad using Apple's latest technologies. This course guides you through modern iOS development using the Swift programming language and the declarative SwiftUI framework. You will learn how to build dynamic user interfaces, manage data, and integrate with powerful iOS frameworks to bring your app ideas to life.
curriculum: Introduction to Xcode and the iOS Simulator
Your First iOS App: Views, Text, and Images
Introduction to SwiftUI and Declarative Syntax
Layouts, Stacks, and State Management with @State
Working with Forms and User Input
Data Modeling and Persistence with SwiftData (or Core Data)
Fetching data from a network API
Working with asynchronous code in Swift
Preparing and submitting your app to the App Store
Final Project: Build an iOS app that interacts with a public API

title: React Native Cross-Platform
description: Build native mobile apps for both iOS and Android from a single JavaScript codebase with React Native. This course leverages your existing React knowledge to create truly native user interfaces. You'll learn about React Native components, styling, navigation, and how to access native device features, enabling you to develop and deploy apps faster.
curriculum: Setting up the React Native Development Environment
Stack, Tab, and Drawer Navigation with React Navigation
Week 3: Working with Data and APIs
Managing state in a React Native app
Working with the device camera and photo library
Final Project: Build a cross-platform app that uses an API and a native feature

title: Flutter Development
description: Create beautiful, natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase with Google's Flutter framework. This course teaches you the Dart programming language and Flutter's widget-based approach to UI development. You'll learn to build expressive and flexible UIs, manage application state, and integrate with services like Firebase.
curriculum: Setting up Flutter and your development environment
Building layouts with basic widgets (Stateless and Stateful)
Advanced State Management with a solution like Provider or BLoC
Integrating with Firebase for backend services (Authentication, Firestore)
Final Project: Build a complete Flutter app with navigation and a remote data source

title: Mobile Backend Services
description: Accelerate your mobile app development by leveraging powerful Backend-as-a-Service (BaaS) platforms. This course focuses on using services like Firebase to quickly add essential backend functionality to your mobile apps without writing server-side code. You'll learn to implement user authentication, real-time databases, push notifications, and offline data synchronization.
curriculum: Storing and retrieving data with Cloud Firestore
Implementing Push Notifications with Firebase Cloud Messaging

title: Mobile App Testing & Deployment
description: Ensure your mobile app is high-quality, bug-free, and successful in the marketplace. This course covers the end-to-end process of testing and releasing mobile applications. You'll learn about different testing strategies, use frameworks for unit and UI testing, and master the process of deploying your app to the Apple App Store and Google Play Store, including App Store Optimization (ASO).
curriculum: UI Testing for Android (Espresso) and iOS (XCUITest)
Introduction to cross-platform testing with tools like Appium
The App Release Process for Google Play and Apple App Store
Setting up CI/CD for mobile apps (e.g., Fastlane, Codemagic)
App Store Optimization (ASO): Keywords, Screenshots, and Descriptions
Monitoring app performance and crashes after release

title: Statistics for Data Science
description: Build the essential mathematical foundation required for any successful data science or machine learning career. This course demystifies statistics, covering core concepts from descriptive statistics to summarize data, to inferential statistics and hypothesis testing to draw meaningful conclusions. You will gain the ability to understand and interpret data correctly, which is crucial for building accurate models.
curriculum: Measures of Central Tendency (Mean, Median, Mode)
Measures of Variability (Variance, Standard Deviation, Range)
Sampling and the Central Limit Theorem
Final Project: Analyze a dataset and draw statistical conclusions

title: Data Analysis with Python
description: Unlock insights from data using Python and its powerful data science ecosystem. This hands-on course is your complete guide to data analysis, teaching you how to manipulate, clean, analyze, and visualize data with essential libraries like Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib. You will learn the entire data analysis workflow, from importing raw data to communicating your findings.
curriculum: Week 1: Introduction to NumPy and Pandas
Introduction to Pandas DataFrames and Series
Introduction to Data Visualization with Matplotlib and Seaborn
Creating various plots (Line, Bar, Scatter, Histogram)
Final Project: Perform a full data analysis on a real-world dataset

title: Data Analysis with R
description: Harness the power of R, the language built by statisticians for statisticians, to perform sophisticated data analysis and create beautiful visualizations. This course focuses on the Tidyverse, a modern collection of R packages for data science. You'll master data manipulation with dplyr and create publication-quality graphics with ggplot2, enabling you to conduct comprehensive statistical modeling.
curriculum: Week 1: R Programming and the Tidyverse
R Syntax, Data Types, and Structures (Vectors, Data Frames)
Data Wrangling with dplyr (filter, arrange, select, mutate)
The Grammar of Graphics with ggplot2
Creating Scatter Plots, Bar Charts, and Box Plots
Introduction to Statistical Modeling in R
Final Project: Analyze and visualize a dataset using R and the Tidyverse

title: Machine Learning Fundamentals
description: Step into the exciting field of machine learning. This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the fundamental concepts and algorithms that allow computers to learn from data. You will explore the two main paradigms—supervised and unsupervised learning—and get hands-on experience building and evaluating models using the popular Python library, Scikit-learn.
curriculum: What is Machine Learning? Types of ML.
Evaluating Classification Models (Accuracy, Precision, Recall, Confusion Matrix)
Introduction to Dimensionality Reduction with PCA
Final Project: Build and evaluate both a classification and a regression model

title: Advanced Machine Learning
description: Elevate your machine learning skills by mastering the advanced techniques used by professionals to build highly accurate and robust models. This course dives deep into powerful ensemble methods, the critical art of feature engineering, and the science of hyperparameter tuning to get the most out of your algorithms.
curriculum: The Theory of Ensembling: Bagging and Boosting
Handling Categorical Data (One-Hot Encoding, Label Encoding)
Creating New Features from Existing Data
Hyperparameter Tuning with Grid Search and Random Search
Final Project: Compete in a Kaggle-style competition to build the best model

title: Deep Learning & Neural Networks
description: Unlock the power of deep learning, the technology behind today's most advanced AI achievements. This course provides a clear and practical introduction to neural networks, guiding you from the basic building blocks to complex architectures. You will get hands-on experience building and training models with leading frameworks like TensorFlow and Keras, focusing on Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for images and Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) for sequential data.
curriculum: From Machine Learning to Deep Learning
Building a simple Neural Network with TensorFlow/Keras
Training a Neural Network: Backpropagation and Gradient Descent
Building an RNN for Text Classification or Time Series
Final Project: Build and train a CNN for an image classification task

title: Natural Language Processing
description: Teach computers to understand and process human language. This course is your entry into the fascinating world of Natural Language Processing (NLP). You will learn essential text preprocessing techniques, build models for tasks like sentiment analysis, and get an introduction to the revolutionary transformer architecture (like BERT and GPT) that powers modern NLP.
curriculum: Representing Text as Numbers: Bag-of-Words, TF-IDF
Topic Modeling with Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA)
Introduction to Sequence-to-Sequence Models and Attention
Using Pre-trained Models (like BERT) with Hugging Face
Final Project: Build a sentiment analysis model for text reviews

title: Computer Vision
description: Enable machines to see and interpret the visual world. This course provides a practical introduction to computer vision, the field of AI focused on analyzing images and video. You will get hands-on experience using the powerful OpenCV library for image processing tasks and learn to implement deep learning models for object detection.
curriculum: Color Spaces and Image Transformations (Resizing, Rotating)
Feature Detectors and Descriptors (e.g., SIFT, ORB)
Classic Object Detection with Haar Cascades
Introduction to Deep Learning-based Object Detection (e.g., YOLO)
Final Project: Build an object detection application using a pre-trained model

title: Big Data Processing
description: Learn to process datasets that are too large to fit on a single machine. This course introduces you to the world of big data and distributed computing, focusing on the industry-standard frameworks: Hadoop and Apache Spark. You will understand the principles of MapReduce and gain extensive hands-on experience with Spark for building scalable data pipelines and performing large-scale data analysis.
curriculum: The Hadoop Ecosystem: HDFS and MapReduce
Spark Architecture: Driver, Executors, and RDDs
Data Ingestion and Export (Parquet, JSON, JDBC)
Building a simple streaming data pipeline
Final Project: Analyze a large dataset using Spark DataFrames

title: MLOps & Model Deployment
description: Bridge the gap between building a machine learning model and putting it into production. This course covers the principles and practices of MLOps (Machine Learning Operations), the discipline focused on the lifecycle of ML models. You will learn how to version your models, track experiments, deploy models as scalable APIs, and monitor their performance in a live environment.
curriculum: Experiment Tracking and Model Versioning (e.g., with MLflow)
Creating a REST API for your model (e.g., with Flask or FastAPI)
Deploying your containerized model (e.g., to a cloud service)
Monitoring for model drift and performance degradation
Introduction to A/B testing for models
Final Project: Deploy a trained Scikit-learn model as a containerized API

title: AI Fundamentals
description: Gain a clear and comprehensive understanding of the field of Artificial Intelligence. This introductory course is perfect for anyone curious about AI, covering its history, the different types of AI, its many real-world applications, and the critical ethical considerations surrounding its development and use. You will learn the terminology and concepts needed to discuss AI intelligently.
curriculum: Types of AI: Narrow (ANI), General (AGI), and Superintelligence (ASI)
Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and their relationship to AI
Real-world applications of AI (e.g., in healthcare, finance, entertainment)
Understanding Neural Networks and Large Language Models conceptually
Ethical considerations: Bias, Fairness, and Transparency in AI

title: Generative AI & LLMs
description: Dive into the revolutionary world of Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs), the technology behind tools like ChatGPT. This course explains how these models work and teaches you the practical skill of prompt engineering to get the best possible results. You will also get an introduction to fine-tuning, the process of adapting pre-trained models for specific tasks.
curriculum: What is Generative AI? (Text, Images, Code)
How Large Language Models (LLMs) are trained
The art and science of writing effective prompts
Advanced prompting techniques (e.g., Chain of Thought)
Working with LLM APIs (e.g., OpenAI API)
Ethical considerations and limitations of LLMs
Final Project: Build an application that uses an LLM to perform a specific task

title: AI Model Development
description: Go beyond using pre-built AI models and learn the end-to-end process of developing your own custom AI solutions. This comprehensive course covers the entire lifecycle, from gathering and preparing data, to selecting the right model architecture, training it effectively, and optimizing its performance for a specific, real-world task.
curriculum: Defining the business problem and success metrics
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing for AI models
Choosing the right model architecture (e.g., CNN, RNN, Transformer)
Monitoring training and diagnosing problems (e.g., overfitting)
Evaluating model performance with appropriate metrics
Final Project: Train a custom deep learning model for a classification task

title: AI Integration & APIs
description: Bring the power of artificial intelligence into your own applications. This practical course teaches you how to integrate state-of-the-art AI capabilities using APIs. You will get hands-on experience working with services like the OpenAI API to build intelligent features, such as chatbots and text generation, and learn the fundamentals of serving your own models as APIs.
curriculum: Making requests to the OpenAI API (or similar)
Best practices for API usage and cost management
Week 2: Building Your Own AI Services
Wrapping a trained model in a simple API (using Flask/FastAPI)
Final Project: Develop a web application that integrates an AI API

title: Computer Vision AI
description: Explore the cutting-edge applications of AI in the field of computer vision. This course moves beyond basic image classification to cover advanced topics like precise object detection, facial recognition systems, and the application of AI in medical imaging. You will also get an introduction to generative models for creating and modifying images.
curriculum: Implementing object detection and tracking in video
Week 3: AI in Medical Imaging and Generative Models
Applications of AI in analyzing medical scans (X-rays, MRIs)
Final Project: Build an advanced computer vision application

title: AI for Business Applications
description: Discover how to identify and implement AI solutions to solve real-world business problems and create value. This course provides a strategic overview of AI's role in the enterprise, covering applications from automating business processes with RPA to building intelligent decision support systems. You will analyze case studies and learn to frame business problems in a way that AI can solve.
curriculum: Identifying opportunities for AI in business
Building a business case for an AI project
Understanding the AI project lifecycle from a business perspective
Week 2: Decision Support and Case Studies
AI for forecasting and predictive analytics
Case studies: AI in Finance, Healthcare, and Retail
Final Project: Propose an AI solution for a given business challenge

title: Information Security Basics
description: Build a strong foundation in the principles of information security. This essential course introduces the core concepts that protect data and systems from threats. You will learn about the CIA Triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability), the fundamentals of risk management, and the importance of security policies and compliance.
curriculum: The CIA Triad: Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability
Introduction to Risk Management Frameworks (e.g., NIST)
Introduction to Compliance Standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA)

title: Network Security
description: Learn to defend the digital perimeter by mastering the fundamentals of network security. This course covers the essential tools and technologies used to protect networks from unauthorized access and attacks. You will get a practical understanding of firewalls, Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), and Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS).
curriculum: Firewall Rules and Access Control Lists (ACLs)
Virtual Private Networks (VPNs): IPsec and SSL
Final Project: Design a secure network layout for a small business

title: Web Application Security
description: Learn to identify and prevent the most common security vulnerabilities that affect web applications. This course is a deep dive into practical web security, centered around the OWASP Top 10 list of critical risks. You will learn how attacks like SQL Injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) work, and more importantly, the secure coding practices needed to defend against them.
curriculum: Week 3: Other Vulnerabilities and Secure Coding
Secure Coding Best Practices (Input Validation, Output Encoding)
Final Project: Perform a security review of a vulnerable web application

title: Cloud Security
description: Secure your infrastructure and data in the cloud. This course covers the unique security challenges of cloud environments and the best practices to address them. You will learn about the shared responsibility model, how to configure Identity and Access Management (IAM) correctly, data encryption strategies, and how to design a secure cloud architecture.
curriculum: The Shared Responsibility Model (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Identity and Access Management (IAM) best practices
Data Encryption at Rest and in Transit
Logging and Monitoring in the cloud (e.g., CloudTrail, CloudWatch)
Incident Response in a cloud environment
Final Project: Design a secure cloud infrastructure for a sample application

title: Incident Response & Forensics
description: Learn what to do when a security breach occurs. This course provides a structured approach to incident response, guiding you through the entire lifecycle from preparation and detection to containment, eradication, and recovery. You will also learn the fundamentals of digital forensics to collect and analyze evidence after an incident.
curriculum: Evidence Collection and Chain of Custody
Basic Forensic Analysis of Systems and Networks
Final Project: Analyze a simulated security incident

title: Security Operations Center
description: Step inside the heart of cybersecurity defense: the Security Operations Center (SOC). This course explains the role and function of a SOC, teaching you the processes and tools used by security analysts to monitor, detect, and respond to threats in real-time. You will get a practical understanding of Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems for log analysis and correlation.
curriculum: The Role and Responsibilities of a SOC
What is a SIEM? (e.g., Splunk, ELK)
Final Project: Investigate a series of alerts in a SIEM environment

title: Ethical Hacking & Penetration Testing
description: Learn to think like an attacker to better defend your systems. This course provides a hands-on introduction to the world of ethical hacking and penetration testing. You will learn a structured methodology for testing, from reconnaissance and scanning to exploitation and post-exploitation, using popular tools from the Kali Linux distribution to identify and assess vulnerabilities.
curriculum: Writing a Professional Penetration Test Report

title: Compliance & Governance
description: Understand the critical role of governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) in information security. This course provides an overview of major regulatory frameworks like GDPR, HIPAA, and SOC 2. You will learn how to conduct risk assessments, participate in security audits, and implement governance frameworks like NIST and ISO 27001 to manage an organization's overall security posture.
curriculum: Introduction to Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC)
Security Governance Frameworks (NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ISO 27001)
Overview of Major Regulations (GDPR, HIPAA, PCI DSS, SOC 2)

title: Manual Testing Fundamentals
description: Master the foundational skills of software quality assurance. This course provides a comprehensive introduction to manual testing, covering the entire Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC). You will learn how to design effective test cases, execute them meticulously, and manage defects professionally, ensuring that software meets quality standards before release.
curriculum: Test Case Design Techniques (Equivalence Partitioning, Boundary Value Analysis)
Writing clear and effective Test Cases
Introduction to Test Management Tools (e.g., Jira/Zephyr)

title: Test Automation with Selenium
description: Transition from manual to automated testing and accelerate your QA career. This course is a deep dive into web application automation using Selenium WebDriver, the industry-standard tool. You will learn to write robust test scripts, interact with web elements, and build a scalable and maintainable automation framework using design patterns like the Page Object Model.
curriculum: Setting up Selenium WebDriver with a programming language (e.g., Java or Python)
Locating Web Elements (ID, Name, XPath, CSS Selectors)
Handling various web elements (Dropdowns, Alerts, Frames)
Synchronization with Implicit and Explicit Waits
Using a Testing Framework (TestNG or PyTest)
The Page Object Model (POM) design pattern
Reading data from external files (e.g., Excel, CSV)
Week 4: Building and Running the Framework
Final Project: Build a complete automation framework for a demo website

title: API Testing
description: Ensure the reliability and correctness of the backbone of modern applications: the API. This course covers both manual and automated API testing. You will learn to use tools like Postman to manually inspect API requests and responses, and then automate your tests using powerful libraries like REST Assured to integrate API testing into your CI/CD pipeline.
curriculum: Week 1: API Fundamentals and Manual Testing
Using Postman for Manual API Testing
Week 2: Automated API Testing with REST Assured
Setting up a REST Assured project
Making GET, POST, PUT, DELETE requests
Authentication and Authorization in API tests
Final Project: Automate the testing of a public REST API

title: Performance Testing
description: Ensure your application can handle real-world user load without crashing. This course introduces the principles of performance testing, teaching you how to plan, script, and execute load tests. You will get hands-on experience with Apache JMeter, a popular open-source tool, to simulate user traffic, analyze performance metrics, and identify application bottlenecks.
curriculum: Types of Performance Testing (Load, Stress, Soak)
Analyzing Results with Listeners and Reports
Final Project: Conduct a load test on a sample web application and analyze the results

title: Mobile App Testing
description: Master the unique challenges of testing mobile applications on both Android and iOS. This course covers the full spectrum of mobile QA, from manual testing on different devices to test automation. You will get hands-on experience with Appium, the leading open-source framework for automating native, hybrid, and mobile web apps, enabling you to write tests that run on multiple platforms.
curriculum: Challenges in Mobile Testing (Devices, OS, Networks)
Manual Testing on Emulators/Simulators and Real Devices
Locating elements in a mobile app
Writing basic automation scripts with Appium
Switching between web and native contexts
Building a mobile test automation framework
Final Project: Automate a key user flow in a sample mobile app

title: Business Analytics Fundamentals
description: Learn to speak the language of data and translate it into actionable business insights. This course provides a foundational understanding of business intelligence and analytics. You will learn how to define and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), understand core BI concepts, and see how data-driven decision-making can transform an organization.
curriculum: Defining Metrics and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Descriptive, Diagnostic, Predictive, and Prescriptive Analytics
Overview of BI Tools (Power BI, Tableau)
Final Project: Define KPIs for a sample business scenario

title: Power BI Development
description: Transform raw data into stunning, interactive visualizations and dashboards with Microsoft Power BI. This course is a comprehensive guide to becoming a Power BI developer. You will learn to connect to various data sources, model your data for analysis, perform complex calculations with the DAX language, and build insightful reports that empower business decisions.
curriculum: Connecting to Data Sources and using Power Query Editor
Building basic visualizations (Bar, Line, Pie charts)
Designing interactive reports with filters and slicers
Publishing to the Power BI Service
Final Project: Build a multi-page interactive dashboard from a given dataset

title: Tableau Advanced
description: Go beyond basic charts and unlock the full analytical power of Tableau. This course is designed for those who want to master advanced Tableau features to create sophisticated visualizations and perform complex data analysis. You will learn to use calculated fields, Level of Detail (LOD) expressions, and advanced design techniques to build highly interactive and insightful dashboards.
curriculum: Level of Detail (LOD) Expressions (FIXED, INCLUDE, EXCLUDE)
Creating complex chart types (e.g., Donut charts, Waterfall charts)
Final Project: Create a complex, interactive dashboard using advanced Tableau features

title: Advanced Excel & VBA
description: Unleash the full potential of Microsoft Excel, the most ubiquitous tool for data analysis. This course dives deep into advanced features, teaching you to analyze large datasets with Pivot Tables and Power Query. You will then learn to automate repetitive tasks and build custom functions by programming with VBA (Visual Basic for Applications), saving you countless hours of manual work.
curriculum: Week 1: Advanced Excel Formulas and Functions
Data Analysis with Pivot Tables and Slicers
Introduction to Power Query for data transformation
The VBA Editor and Basic Syntax
Automating tasks with loops and conditionals in VBA
Final Project: Build an automated report in Excel using VBA

title: Blockchain Development
description: Step into the world of decentralized applications (DApps) and Web3. This course provides a practical introduction to blockchain technology and smart contract development. You will learn the fundamentals of how blockchains work and get hands-on experience writing, testing, and deploying smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain using the Solidity programming language.
curriculum: Introduction to Ethereum and Smart Contracts
Setting up a development environment (Remix, Hardhat)
Solidity Data Types, Variables, and Functions
Interacting with smart contracts from a frontend (web3.js/ethers.js)
Testing and Deploying your Smart Contract
Final Project: Build a simple decentralized application

title: IoT & Embedded Systems
description: Learn to build smart, connected devices and step into the Internet of Things (IoT). This hands-on course introduces you to the world of embedded systems using popular, accessible platforms like Raspberry Pi and Arduino. You will learn to write code that interacts with the physical world, integrate sensors to gather data, and connect your devices to the internet.
curriculum: Week 1: Introduction to Embedded Systems and Arduino
What is IoT? What is an Embedded System?
Introduction to Arduino and its IDE
Week 2: Working with Sensors and Actuators
Introduction to Linux and Python on the Pi
Connecting your device to the Internet
Sending sensor data to an IoT cloud platform (e.g., MQTT)
Final Project: Build a complete IoT device that collects and transmits sensor data

title: Game Development
description: Turn your passion for games into a creative skill. This course is your entry point into the exciting world of game development, providing a practical introduction to the industry-leading game engines, Unity and Unreal Engine. You will learn the core concepts of game development, from creating scenes and scripting gameplay to understanding game physics and character control.
curriculum: Introduction to Game Objects, Scenes, and Assets
Core Concepts: Game Loops, Input, and Physics
Choose an engine to expand on your project
Adding UI elements, sound, and simple AI
Final Project: Create a playable prototype of a simple game

title: AR/VR Development
description: Step into the future of computing by learning to build immersive augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) experiences. This course provides a hands-on introduction to AR and VR development, teaching you how to create interactive applications that blend the digital and physical worlds. You will learn the fundamentals of 3D interaction and build projects for popular platforms.
curriculum: Understanding the difference between AR, VR, and MR
Overview of the AR/VR hardware landscape (e.g., Quest, HoloLens)
Setting up a development environment (Unity with AR/VR SDKs)
Building a basic interactive VR scene
Plane detection and placing virtual objects in the real world
Final Project: Build a simple AR or VR application

title: Quantum Computing Basics
description: Explore the next frontier of computation with this introduction to quantum computing. This course demystifies the core concepts of quantum mechanics that power quantum computers, such as superposition and entanglement. You will get a conceptual understanding of famous quantum algorithms and take your first steps in quantum programming using IBM's Qiskit framework.
curriculum: Introduction to key Quantum Algorithms (e.g., Shor's, Grover's)
Running a quantum circuit on a simulator and real quantum hardware
Final Project: Implement a simple quantum algorithm in Qiskit

title: Edge Computing
description: Learn to process data closer to where it's generated with Edge Computing. This course explores the architecture that brings computation and data storage closer to the sources of data, resulting in lower latency and reduced bandwidth usage. You will understand the relationship between edge, fog, and cloud computing, and explore use cases in IoT and real-time processing.
curriculum: What is Edge Computing? Why is it needed?
Edge vs. Cloud Computing: Trade-offs and Benefits
Use Cases for Edge Computing (IoT, Autonomous Vehicles)
Deploying applications to the edge (e.g., using containerization)

title: Microservices Architecture
description: Learn to design and build modern, scalable, and resilient applications using the microservices architectural style. This course moves beyond monolithic applications to teach you how to break down complex systems into small, independent services. You will learn about key patterns and technologies for inter-service communication, service discovery, and managing distributed systems with tools like API gateways and service meshes.
curriculum: Containerization and Orchestration (Docker/Kubernetes) in a Microservices context
Final Project: Design a microservices architecture for a given application

title: Enterprise Integration
description: Learn how to make disparate software systems within an organization communicate and share data effectively. This course covers the fundamental patterns and technologies of Enterprise Application Integration (EAI). You will explore different integration styles and get a practical understanding of key technologies like message queues (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka) and the role of an Enterprise Service Bus (ESB).
curriculum: Integration Styles (File Transfer, Shared Database, RPC, Messaging)
Introduction to Apache Kafka for event streaming
The role of an Enterprise Service Bus (ESB)
Final Project: Design an integration solution for a business scenario

title: Technical Communication
description: Amplify your impact as a technology professional by mastering the art of clear and effective communication. This essential soft skills course will teach you how to write excellent technical documentation, deliver compelling presentations, participate constructively in code reviews, and communicate complex ideas to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
curriculum: Communicating via email and instant messaging

title: Project Management for Tech
description: Learn to lead technology projects and teams to success. This course introduces the most popular project management methodologies used in the software industry today: Agile, Scrum, and Kanban. You will learn the principles, roles, and ceremonies of each framework, enabling you to improve team collaboration, increase predictability, and deliver value faster.
curriculum: The Scrum Framework: Roles (Product Owner, Scrum Master, Dev Team)
Scrum Events (Sprints, Daily Stand-up, Review, Retrospective)
The Kanban Method: Visualizing Workflow and Limiting WIP
Key metrics in Kanban (Lead Time, Cycle Time)

title: System Design & Architecture
description: Ace your senior-level technical interviews by mastering system design. This course teaches you a structured approach to solving open-ended design problems, such as 'Design Twitter' or 'Design Netflix.' You will learn the fundamental building blocks of scalable systems, common architectural patterns, and how to intelligently discuss the trade-offs of your design choices.
curriculum: A framework for system design interviews
Databases: SQL vs. NoSQL, Replication, and Sharding
Case Study: Design a URL Shortener
Case Study: Design a Social Media Feed
Case Study: Design a Video Streaming Service
Final Project: Work through a complete system design problem

title: Tech Career Development
description: Navigate the tech industry and build a successful, fulfilling career. This course provides practical advice on the entire job-seeking process, from crafting a resume that gets noticed to acing both behavioral and technical interviews. You will also learn valuable strategies for networking, negotiating offers, and planning your long-term career growth.
curriculum: Building a professional online presence (LinkedIn, GitHub)
Preparing for technical interviews (coding challenges, system design)
